page.title: 04BOUNDARIES
page.content: There were 117 fields or part fields in our block. We looked at boundaries on half these.When counting we counted each boundary as belonging to a separate field so each was counted twice if it bounded 2 fields.{Walls } 69 dry stone walls (made of local stones laid on top of each other with no bonding material).State of repair varied & many had shrubby growth or trees alongside.{Hedges }5.Hedges were hawthorn, elder,blackthorn,sometimes trimmed mechanically if at all. If layered it was only once early in life of hedge.{Wire}11, much in poor repair. Wire was netting or barbed wire attached to fence posts. {Wooden {rails}approximately 6 all used in connection with grazing horses.
